title: A Day at the Dairy Farm
text: Fixing the irrigation. Veterinary biosecurity keeps the herd healthy. We record yields and monitor feed intake. This is my routine at the dairy farm. Irrigation is scheduled to reduce water waste. The tractor needs a safety check before operation. The greenhouse helps control temperature and humidity. I adjust irrigation when the soil is dry. I use simple tools for daily tasks. Sprayer calibration prevents over application. We rotate pastures to improve forage quality. We follow safety steps in the barn. Farm safety rules are part of our routine. We start work before sunrise during harvest. In winter we protect equipment from freezing.
